resources.string: Signets are part of the endgame gearing in TSW that provide a proc effect or passive stat boost. They can be attached to a talisman or weapon with a Signet Slot in order to combine the effect with the item itself.

Signets are divided into three types: green, blue and purple. It takes ten identical green signets to form a blue signet of the same name and ten identical blue signets to form a purple signet.\n(Note: you need 100 green signets with the same name to build one purple signet)
(Note: an overview of all available signets can be found in the "Main Menu" > "Signet Overview")
To attach a signet, place the item and the signet in the Assembly window and click the “Assambly” button. The item must be at full durability. \n(Note: the item must be at full durability)
If an item contains a signet you can overwrite it with a new one. \n(Note: the old signet will be destroyed)
> CLOSE Where do I get Signets?

Signets cannot be crafted, but there are three possibilities to get signets:
 > dropped by Nightmare and Lair mobs
 (Note: drop rate is low)
 (Note: where to find these mobs can be found in the Main Menu > Farming Locations)

 > Quests (Note: one Signet Bag as reward after completion; 68 hour cooldown)
 (Note: which quests guarantee signets and their locations can be found in the Main Menu > Quests)

 > brought in/at the Bank or Mail in London under Buy > Upgrade > Signets ( TODO get exact names)
(Note: very expensive)
